com:
"Consider the cattle, grazing as they pass you by: they do not know what is meant by yesterday or today, they leap about, eat, rest, digest, leap about again, and so from morn till night and from day to day, fettered to the moment and its pleasure or displeasure, and thus neither melancholy nor bored. This is a hard sight for man to see; for, though he thinks himself better than the animals because he is human, he cannot help envying them their happiness – what they have, a life neither bored nor painful, is precisely what he wants, yet he cannot have it because he refuses to be like an animal..."
-Friedrich Nietzsche

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>28650566
NTA but you really don't know what you're talking about

Self-overcoming is a major theme of Nietzsche. His thesis isn't that you have some transcendental nature that you must release your illusions to embrace - that's a very [current year] reading of him, because that's what the media metanarrative currently emphasizes.

Nietzsche's emphasis was on the constructed nature of categories, meaning that Man sees himself as a man, above the beasts of the field. Is he not a mere beast? or is he an animal denying his nature? The answer is both and neither - he is an animal in whose nature it is to raise himself above other beasts. To deny himself the serenity of the cow is every bit as much a part of man's nature as that serenity is of the nature of the cow.

This whole thread is probably the most braindead interpretation of Nietzche I've ever seen on this site, and that says a lot. You can't just take what the guy says at face value there's layers

sub: Is T4T AGP? If so, what am I?
com:
This question is important to the culture of /lgbt/, yet no one asks it because they're afraid.

Now, is it AGP to be attracted to other trans women? One could view it as a form of mirror attraction, or as a form of pseudo-lesbianism. However, I would disagree. When dissected, being attracted to other trans women as a trans woman doesn't seem to have anything to do with the idea of fetishistic love of yourself as a woman, though to an extent all tranny activity could be viewed as inherently autogynephilic.

As for me, I do fit the typical profile of an HSTS tranny. Youngshit, had signs since I was a toddler, considered to be fembrained by others, considered to pass by others, and WAS exclusively attracted to men--until a flip where I find myself to have this insatiable lust for other trans women.
I guess the second question I propose is: what turns an HSTS into an AGP? Was I AGP all along, or has my brain somehow changed? Has my sexuality changed, and is this due to HRT? Or am I just a bisexual with a genital preference?

Help me out here /lgbt/, how has your experience with sexuality impacted your sense of self? Is being attracted to other trans women autogynephilic? Am I AGP, and if so should I cope and just date men to preserve my HSTS status?

Obviously it's not a very long time but I've read (at least with steroids) it can take months and months to reach pre-hrt levels of testosterone when the HPT axis gets shut down and natural testosterone levels get nuked. I can't seem to find any data at all on post-hrt treatment for men who've taken estrogen, so I don't have much choice but to follow similar protocols that steroid users do after cycles.

I currently have raloxifene and tamoxifen, possibly looking to add clomid or hCG if necessary. So far I'm waiting for 5.5x the half life of the ester (enanthate) before taking 10-20mg of tamoxifen daily for ~30 days. Am I screwing myself over by not taking it with clomid and/or hCG? Does anybody else have any experience with this, or know of any resources regarding how to have a successful "detransition therapy"?
